alert.note: Alert for Hall (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 1:13AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hall County through 145 AM CDT... At 112 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shelton, or 17 miles southwest of Grand Island, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Alda around 125 AM CDT. Doniphan around 130 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Grand Island. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 293 and 317. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.
